title: Make a Quarto book
text:
1 Introduction
Guide to building a book in Quarto and publishing on github.io for Conte ecohydrology crew.


Session Information





Code
sessionInfo()


R version 4.4.2 (2024-10-31)
Platform: aarch64-apple-darwin20
Running under: macOS Sequoia 15.2

Matrix products: default
BLAS:   /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/4.4-arm64/Resources/lib/libRblas.0.dylib 
LAPACK: /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/4.4-arm64/Resources/lib/libRlapack.dylib;  LAPACK version 3.12.0

locale:
[1] en_US.UTF-8/en_US.UTF-8/en_US.UTF-8/C/en_US.UTF-8/en_US.UTF-8

time zone: America/New_York
tzcode source: internal

[1] stats     graphics  grDevices utils     datasets  methods   base

title: 2  Bushnell Camera Guide
text:
3 Camera Overview

3.0.1 Undo Latch on camera to open it like a book.
Overall Camera Layout

LCD Screen

Display Camera Settings

POWER/ MODE SWITCH

Turn Camera ON/OFF and allows user to access SETUP MODE

SWITCHEd

Navigate and program camera settings

SD Card Slot

Make sure SD card is not locked
Insert SD card with label facing upwards
A click sound indicates SD card is inserted correctly
To remove

gently push and the card should spring back and then it can be removed


Battery Compartment

Put 8 AA batteries
Line Up Negative/Positive symbols on camera to Negative/Positive on batteries





3.0.2 Buttons

POWER/ MODE SWITCH

ON = Power switch in the ON position (LCD screen is off.)
SETUP = SETUP mode: Power switch at SETUP position (LCD screen is on).

Check and Change the settings of the camera

OFF = OFF mode: Power switch in the OFF position

MENU

Pressing MENU allows you to select any parameter and change its settings.

OK

save the new setting

Arrow Keys

RIGHT/LEFT

Scrolls to the next or previous parameters

UP/DOWN

Select a different setting for the currently displayed parameter






Bushnell Model A Keys





Bushnell Model B Keys




3.0.3 Screen

Mode Camera

Camera symbol means camera in camera mode

Image Resolution

Should be HD

SD Card

Clear if SD card is not locked
If SD card is locked a lock symbol will appear in center

Battery Level
Date/Time
Remaining Photo Capacity

Total number of photos SD card can hold

# of Photos Taken

Number of photos on SD card

Field Scan ON

Will appear if Field Scan is ON.
Blank if Field Scan is OFF

Time Stamp ON

Will appear if Time Stamp is ON
Blank of Time Stamp is OFF






4 Power Camera On

Put 8 AA Batteries into the Battery Compartment

Refer to Camera Overview section , subsection 2 , subsection 5 ( Battery Compartment )

Install SD CARD

Refer to Camera Overview section , subsection 2 , subsection 4 ( SD Card Slot )

Move POWER/MODE SWITCH switch to SETUP position

SETUP position brings up the set up mode screen

LCD Screen should turn on




5 Menu/Settings

Press MENU Button
Use LEFT/RIGHT Keys to scroll to the next or previous parameters
For this guide use the RIGHT key to proceed


5.0.1 Set Mode -Set Clock

Hit OK to enter the Settings




5.0.2 Set Date/ Time

Move Cursor using ( LEFT/RIGHT Keys )
Change Selected ( UP/DOWN Keys )
Set All Values ( OK Button )




5.0.3 Set Mode - PreSets

Using the UP/DOWN keys select Advanced
Press OK to set
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.4 Set Mode - Mode

Using the UP/DOWN keys select Camera
Press OK to set
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.5 Set Mode - Image Size

Using UP/DOWN keys select HD
Press OK Button to set
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.6 Set Mode - Image Format

Using UP/DOWN keys select Full Screen
Press OK Button to set
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.7 Set Mode - Capture Number

Using UP/DOWN keys select 1 Photo
Press OK Button to set
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.8 Set Mode - LED Control

Using UP/DOWN keys select High
Press OK Button to set
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.9 Set Mode - Camera Name

Skip
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.10 Set Mode - Video Size

Skip
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.11 Set Mode - Video Length

Skip
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.12 Set Mode - Interval

Skip
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.13 Set Mode - Sensor Level

Using UP/DOWN keys select Low
Press OK to set
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.14 Set Mode - NV Shutter

Using UP/DOWN keys select Auto
Press OK to set
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.15 Set Mode - Camera Mode

Using the UP/DOWN key set to 24hrs
Press OK to set
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.16 Set Mode - Format

Skip
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.17 Set Mode - Time Stamp

Skip
Press RIGHT button to proceed




5.0.18 Set Mode Field Scan

Using the UP/DOWN key set to On
Press OK to set/enter settings




5.0.19 Interval

Using the UP/DOWN key to find Interval
Press OK Button

Set Interval - 15 Mins

Use UP/DOWN Keys to Change.
Press OK Button to set.


Field Scan A

Use DOWN key to find Set Mode - Field Scan A
Press OK to enter settings

Field Scan A - Settings

Use LEFT/RIGHT Keys to Navigate and UP/DOWN keys to select your preference.
Set Start to 00:00 and Stop to 12:00
Press OK to Set



Field Scan B

Use DOWN key to find Set Mode - Field Scan B
Press OK to enter settings

Field Scan B - Settings

Use LEFT/RIGHT Keys to Navigate and UP/DOWN keys to select your preference.
Set Start to 12:15 and Stop to 23:45
Press OK to Set



Press OK Button to Set / Exit
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.20 Set Mode - Coordinate Input

Skip
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.21 Set Mode-Video Sound

Skip
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.22 Set Mode - Default Set

Skip
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.23 Set Mode - Version

Skip
Press RIGHT key to proceed




5.0.24 END of MENU Settings

Pressing of RIGHT key should return you to Time Set.
You Now can either

Press RIGHT or LEFT keys to return to any of the setting options.
Press MENU to exit and return to Standby Page






6 Downloading a Camera

Arrive at Camera
Unlock Pad Lock and remove camera from housing ( remove if you can )
Open Camera

POWER/MODE SWITCH Should be ON
Take Photo of it (Like the one pictured below), even if it is OFF

The photo will allow user to both confirm it was on and if the SD card had no images it was a SD card or camera malfunction.



Move POWER/MODE SWITCH to OFF

Remove SD Card

Refer to Camera Overview section , subsection 2 , subsection 4 ( SD Card Slot )


Insert Blank SD Card

Move POWER/MODE SWITCH to SETUP

LCD Screen Will Turn ON.
IF LCD Screen does not turn ON.

Move Power Switch to OFF
Replace Batteries



Check Time

Take photo exactly like one below.
If time differs change it.
Follow from MENU sections use sub section 1. to Set Clock to adjust time
This camera was 2 min ahead so had to subtract 2 min


Check other Settings

Camera Mode
Field Scan On
Battery Level

If 1/3 change batteries

SD Card Unlocked
If settings are good take a photo exactly like the one below.


Deploy Camera

Move Power Switch to ON
Take Photo exactly like on below.

The photo will allow the user to confirm that the camera is on when they are not at camera



Put Camera Back in Housing and have a nice day

title: 3  SVMAQ SOP
text:
4.2 Fill In General Information


STATION ( Site Number, ie Avery Brook 01171000 )
Station Name - (Auto Fills)
Date ( Date of gage visit )
Time ( Time of Arrival at Gage ) ( Don’t change for Daylight vs Non Daylight )
Party ( Initials of all personal present for site visit )

WEA


Filled out

Comments


Options

Site Visit = ( Tape Down, Control Inspection )
QM = ( Flow Measurement )
GHZF = ( Gage Height at Zero Flow )
CSG = ( Crest Stage Gage - Bucket Test, and Read )
Levels = Level Set Done
Camera Download = ( FPE camera was downloaded. )

Comment on anything that will be valuable to an accurate discharge monitoring.

Tree blocking control.
Gage fallen.


Save File

Click File then Save As…




File Gets Saved .

Site Number ( 01171000 )
Date ( 20220604 )
Start Time ( 102900 )



5 SITE VISIT TASKS

Click on Button in bottom right of screen SITE VISIT TASKS



Options

GZF Inspection - Gage Height at Zero Flow
Control Inspection - Where you enter weather the control is blocked.
Sensor Inspections - Put your Stage readings in whether it be from a reference point or a real time sensor.

CSG Data will go in here.

Station Levels - Both where levels are entered and all RP and RM values are stored.
Discharge Measurement - Where both flow tracker files is stored and any information corresponding to the sensor.

Tip

To get into any tab just click on yellow box.


5.1 Control Inspection

Blank



Filled



Options

Control Type ( Section, Channel , Combined chan/sect )

Section

Channel


Distance to gage (ft) - How far away the control is from the sensor.
Control Cleaned - If there is debris blocking the flow of water through the control was it removed?

If Yes specify the Time debris was removed.

Control Condition

If control was clear select Clear.
If control was not specify the type of debris and degree it was blocking the control.

Comments

If control was clear write “Control was Clear”
If control was not clear write what was affecting it.
If control has changed note that too. ( Scour, Fill or Channel Shape has changed.)



Sensor Inspection

Click on Sensor Inspections.

Math Entry

We do this with our initial gage height reading from a RP to make sure the math is correct.
Highlight Line with RP then click Create/View Inspection.

By pressing this, a panel containing a blank sheet to do the mathematics calculation of gage height will open.

What to enter

RP Value with label ( 4.892 (RP-1) )
-/+ depending if it was a Tape Up or Tape Down ( - )
Tape Up or Down Value ( 1.00 )
Value Not Rounded to Hundredth of a foot. ( 3.892 )
Rounded Value ( 3.89 )

Finished Entry


Sensor Heights Entry

Highlight RP Line and Click on Gage Readings

Page with all the sensors that measure gage height corresponding to a gage.
Click on the box below RP Gage height Gage height, reference point ft.

Enter in Initial Gage Height value from RP. 3.88 and click DONE

Next Enter both

Time of Reading
Uncertainty to the left of units. This is how uncertain you are about your measurement. It will increase if the water is bobbing up and down like in a large storm.

For this visit the the water was bobbing slightly so I am +/- 0.02 uncertainty about my measured value of 1.00 foot.



When done click ADD

For Real Time Only If not Skip to Step 8.

If sensor reading was at same time as Initial RP enter on same line. If not enter on new line.
Click on box corresponding to sensor read and enter value read, time but not uncertainty.
When done click add.


Repeat Steps 3-7 until all sensor values are entered.
When all values are entered hit Done.



GHZ Inspection

Blank



Filled

Options

Time - Time GHZF was taken.
Stage (ft) - Stage at time of GHZF measurement
Water Depth (ft) - water depth of GHZF

Uncertainty of the water depth measurement.

GZF (ft) - Auto Fills base off Stage and Water Depth Values
Comment - Tell where in the control the GHZF was taken.




Options
